headline: Leidos Expands Federal Cybersecurity Role As Valuation Lags Analyst Targets
summary: Leidos Holdings (NYSE:LDOS) has secured a new $142 million federal contract focused on AI driven secure web applications. The company is rapidly migrating more than 100,000 defense agency users to DODNet under the Defense Enclave Services program. Leidos is expanding its role in cybersecurity and AI governance through alliances with RegScale and Trustible. Leidos Holdings, trading at about $176.3 per share, sits in the middle of several large federal technology shifts, particularly in...

headline: Assessing Leidos Holdings (LDOS) Valuation After New Federal Tech And AI Cybersecurity Contracts
summary: Leidos Holdings (LDOS) is back in focus after announcing several large U.S. federal technology wins, including an accelerated DODNet migration effort and a US$142 million AI-driven cybersecurity modernization contract tied to Defense Information Systems Agency programs. See our latest analysis for Leidos Holdings. Despite recent contract wins and partnerships around AI governance and cybersecurity, Leidos Holdings’ share price has been under pressure, with a 7.61% decline in its 1-month share...
